pr_title: TRUNK-5887 Validation error when starting Reference Metadata module on PostgreSQL

timeline.message: TRUNK-5887 Validation error when starting Reference Metadata module on PostgreSQL

timeline.bodyText: Aren't we going to have to do this in many places? Did you evaluate other options? Like switching the file size to 36?
timeline.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText:
@dkayiwa , yes and as I am testing and getting validation errors, I am making the changes. One another ticket I raised today holds a similar problem.
Making uuid columns char(36) or varchar(38) did come in my mind, but isn't there any reason that why in OpenMRS we have set UUID columns as char(38) everywhere?
replies.author: Am-Coder

replies.bodyText: https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/TRUNK-1283
replies.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText: Oh now I see the reason. So dropping to char(36) is never an option. One solution I found of creating custom char type like this here but then if our main concern is the amount of code changes that will be needed then we will have to map uuid types to this custom type that we create everywhere. So, I went with the trim option.
replies.author: Am-Coder

replies.bodyText: Can we write the custom liquibase class that automatically maps to char(36) for PostgreSQL?
replies.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText: Let me look into it. I know something similar has been done for boolean conversion to tinyint(1) for MySQL.
replies.author: Am-Coder

replies.bodyText: I'd actually think that we'd want to just change all UUID columns to 36 characters. The likelihood that we need to contend with Microsoft-generated UUIDs seems to me exceedingly small (and in those cases, we should just be removing the curly-braces anyways).
replies.author: ibacher
Am-Coder

replies.bodyText: @Am-Coder Do examples like that exist outside of the referencedemodata module? If not, shouldn't we just fix that module?
replies.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText: @ibacher , Let me check after correcting this uuid if I get error refering to uuid in other modules while initializing Reference Application.
replies.author: Am-Coder

replies.bodyText:
@ibacher , I just corrected it here and there is no other error in any other module or reference demo data module related to uuid being more then 36 characters. But for correction I just removed the last extra character. So, we are good to go with char(36) for PostgreSQL after this correction.
@dkayiwa , what is your say on this to keep uuid to char(36) or varchar(38) and whether this be done for MySQL as well ?
replies.author: Am-Coder

replies.bodyText: Doing a uuid of 36 characters makes more sense.
replies.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText: @dkayiwa  @ibacher , Made the changes to convert char(38) to char(36) for PostgreSQL. Once this issue gets resolved we are good to go to initialize Reference Application on PostgreSQL. Currently, with these changes, I am able to run Reference Application on PostgreSQL 🙂
replies.author: Am-Coder

timeline.bodyText: What if it is another char(38) field which is not a uuid?
timeline.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText:
@dkayiwa  @ibacher , I couldn't find a way to get access to column name within the scope of this method. Apparently, what I have understood is we will have to make the changes in diferent change classes here and this does not seem right.
If we hold a possibility of having any other fields with char(38), what if we apparently make change to using varchar(38) and if we finally are ready to revert https://issues.openmrs.org/browse/TRUNK-1283 , then we make char(36) directly into liquibase changesets for both MySQL and PostgreSQL rather then going this way ?
replies.author: Am-Coder

replies.bodyText: Would the revert require touching all existing changesets?
replies.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText: Yes, that is what I have in mind.
replies.author: Am-Coder

replies.bodyText: Would that require a validation checksum for the so many changesets?
replies.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText: Apparently, Yes.
replies.author: Am-Coder

replies.bodyText: That would be too many changes.
replies.author: dkayiwa

replies.bodyText: Rather than reverting (which isn't really the way to go) would it make sense to just add a new changeset downsizing the UUID fields?
replies.author: ibacher

replies.bodyText:
A changeset like this ( I took it from the docs ) :
<changeSet  author="liquibase-docs"  id="modifyDataType-example">  
    <modifyDataType  catalogName="cat"  
            columnName="id"  
            newDataType="int"  
            schemaName="public"  
            tableName="person"/>  
</changeSet>

would then need to be added for each table present in core as well as all the ref. application modules. Wouldn't it be adding some overhead ?
replies.author: Am-Coder
